title: Add home page and exercise library management

requirements.summary: Create a home page as the landing route with navigation to main sections
acceptanceCriteria: Home page is accessible at the root route "/"
Navigation to Exercise Library, Workouts, Log Weight, and Progress sections is present
Page follows the existing dark theme styling with red accents

file_operations.description: Create a home page component with hero section and navigation cards to Exercise Library, Workouts, Log Weight, and Progress sections. Use existing dark theme with red accent colors from index.css. Include app branding and brief description of FitTrack Pro features.
Register the Home page as the root route ("/") in the TanStack Router configuration. Add route definition before or alongside existing routes for exercises, workouts, logging, and progress pages.
Add a link to the Home page in the navigation header. Ensure the home link has proper active state styling consistent with other navigation links.

requirements.summary: Add functionality to create new exercises in the exercise library
acceptanceCriteria: User can add a new exercise through a form with name, equipment, and muscle group inputs
New exercise is persisted in the backend
Exercise library updates to show the new exercise immediately after creation

file_operations.description: Add a useCreateExerciseMutation hook that calls the backend createExercise method with name, equipmentType, and muscleGroup parameters. Include automatic query invalidation to refresh the exercise list after successful creation.

Add a button to open a create exercise dialog/form. Include form fields for exercise name (text input), equipment type (dropdown), and muscle group (dropdown). Wire the form submission to the useCreateExerciseMutation hook. Show success toast notification after creation. Ensure the exercise list automatically refreshes to display the newly created exercise.

requirements.summary: Add functionality to edit existing exercises in the exercise library
acceptanceCriteria: User can edit an existing exercise's details
Changes are persisted in the backend
Exercise library reflects the updated information immediately

file_operations.description: Add a useUpdateExerciseMutation hook that calls the backend updateExercise method with id, name, equipmentType, and muscleGroup parameters. Include automatic query invalidation to refresh the exercise list after successful update.

Add an edit button to each ExerciseCard that opens an edit dialog/form pre-populated with the exercise's current details. Include form fields for name, equipment type, and muscle group. Wire the form submission to the useUpdateExerciseMutation hook. Show success toast notification after update.

requirements.summary: Add functionality to delete exercises from the exercise library
acceptanceCriteria: User can delete an exercise from the library
Deletion is persisted in the backend
Exercise is removed from the library view immediately
Confirmation prompt is shown before deletion

file_operations.description: Add a useDeleteExerciseMutation hook that calls the backend deleteExercise method with the exercise id parameter. Include automatic query invalidation to refresh the exercise list after successful deletion.

Add a delete button to each ExerciseCard that triggers a confirmation dialog before deletion. Wire the confirmation action to the useDeleteExerciseMutation hook. Show success toast notification after deletion. Ensure the exercise is removed from the library view immediately after successful deletion.
